sentences.sContent: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
sentences.sCn: 尽管身体不好，她仍继续执行任务。

sentences.sContent: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
sentences.sCn: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金，但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。

sentences.sContent: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
sentences.sCn: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气，却并不赞成他的方法。

sentences.sContent: ...their memories are highly self-centred: although they can remember “autobiographical” life events in extraordinary detail...
...although sometimes there are some defects in medical infrastructure...
...although I've always listened to recordings of great orchestras from Europe...
...because although it's full of rich people...
...And although you don't read about this much...
...although the current emphasis on preparing young Americans for STEM science...
...The government has not yet taken any action to regulate sugar consumption although it indicated its intention to do so some time ago...
...Cohen said although he and his co-author are optimistic about many aspects of the Internet...

trans.tranOther: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely
